name: A.P. (DIR Series) Circular No. 26
summary: This circular provides clarifications and regulations regarding Foreign Portfolio Investors' (FPI) investments in debt securities. It introduces a 20% cap on investments in corporate bonds with residual maturity below one year, bringing consistency across debt categories including G-secs and SDLs. The circular also clarifies various operational aspects including the definition of related FPIs, concentration limits, and implementation timeline for online monitoring of G-sec limits.
questions: What is the maximum percentage of total investment allowed for securities with residual maturity below one year in any category?
What is the implementation date set for online monitoring of utilization of G-sec limits?
How is the term 'related FPIs' defined in the circular?
What is the deadline given to FPIs to bring their investments below 20% if they exceed this limit as of May 2, 2018?
Are FPIs permitted to invest in treasury bills issued by the Central Government?
